senses.de: The ability to identify tasks that need to be accomplished and make a decision to go ahead with them without being told by others.
senses.ex: She showed great initiative when she started the new project on her own.

Tips.title: Self-starting Quality
Tips.description: Describes someone who begins work or tasks without prompting.
Tips.example: He takes initiative by volunteering for assignments before anyone asks.

Tips.title: Positive Trait
Tips.description: Often seen as a leadership quality and highly valued by employers.
Tips.example: Her initiative in streamlining the process impressed her superiors.

Tips.title: Autonomous Action
Tips.description: Acting on one's own volition without waiting for direction.
Tips.example: Taking initiative, he resolved the customer's complaint immediately.

senses.de: A new plan or process to achieve something or solve a problem.
senses.ex: The government's new initiative to reduce plastic waste has been welcomed by environmentalists.

Tips.title: Objective-oriented
Tips.description: Refers specifically to strategies designed to meet a goal.
Tips.example: Their initiative targeted childhood obesity reduction.

Tips.title: Problem-solving Method
Tips.description: Implies a response to a challenge or an issue that needs addressing.
Tips.example: The recycling initiative dealt with the city's waste management crisis.

Tips.title: Action Plan
Tips.description: A set of actions with intended results, often formal or official.
Tips.example: The mayor announced a new initiative to improve public transportation.

senses.de: The right or ability to introduce new laws or changes in a political context.
senses.ex: Voters will decide the outcome of the tax initiative in November.

Tips.title: Legislative Power
Tips.description: Gives citizens the ability to propose and vote on laws directly.
Tips.example: The clean air initiative will appear on the next ballot.

Tips.title: Democratic Process
Tips.description: Enables public participation in governmental decision-making.
Tips.example: Through a voter initiative, residents could push for new parks.

Tips.title: Civil Engagement
Tips.description: Highlights community involvement in political processes.
Tips.example: The community's initiative helped change local zoning laws.

Creativity.wordDefinition:
Creativity refers to the ability to come up with new and original ideas, concepts or solutions, while initiative is the willingness to take action and be proactive in pursuing a goal or objective.

Creativity is more applicable in areas that require innovative thinking such as art, design, and problem-solving. Initiative is more applicable in areas that require action such as leadership positions, entrepreneurship, and community involvement.

Creativity is about coming up with new ideas while initiative is about taking action to implement those ideas.

Drive.wordDefinition:
Drive refers to a person's motivation and determination to achieve a goal. It is the force that pushes you towards success, while initiative is the first step or action taken to start a task, project or activity.

For example, if you have a drive to succeed in your studies, you will work hard, set goals, and take actions to achieve those goals.

Drive is a person's motivation and determination towards achieving a goal, while initiative is taking the first step or action to start a task or project.

Enterprise.wordDefinition:
Enterprise refers to a large and organized business, typically with many employees and resources. It is applicable when referring to a company or corporation.

For example, "Apple is a large enterprise that produces computers and phones."

Enterprise refers to a large business, while initiative refers to taking action to start something new.

Ingenuity.wordDefinition:
Ingenuity refers to the ability to think creatively and come up with clever solutions to problems. It usually involves using creativity and intelligence to solve complex problems.

Ingenuity is applicable in situations where there are technical or complex issues that need to be solved.

Ingenuity is about coming up with ideas and solutions while initiative is about taking action towards those solutions.

Inventive.wordDefinition:
Inventive refers to the ability to create or produce something new or original. This involves using creativity and imagination to come up with innovative ideas and solutions.

Inventiveness is useful in situations where someone needs to come up with new ideas or solutions to problems.

For example, someone with initiative might take the initiative to organize a school fundraiser without being asked, while someone who is inventive might come up with a new and creative way to raise money that nobody else has thought of before.

Leadership.wordDefinition:
Leadership is the ability to guide and motivate a group of people towards a common goal. It involves setting a direction, inspiring others, and coordinating efforts to achieve objectives.

While initiative is applicable in a wide range of situations, leadership is specifically associated with guiding a group or organization.

Initiative is about taking the first step, whereas leadership is about taking responsibility for the direction and success of a collective effort.

Originality.wordDefinition:
Initiative means taking action without being told or asked to, while originality means having new or creative ideas that are unique and not copied from others.

Originality is applicable in situations where one needs to come up with new ideas, concepts or solutions. It refers to creativity and imagination, and encourages people to think outside the box and bring fresh perspectives to the table.

In essence, initiative is about taking action while originality is about generating new and innovative ideas.

Resourceful.wordDefinition:
Resourceful refers to the ability to find solutions and be creative in solving problems, using whatever resources are available.

Both initiative and resourcefulness are important qualities to have, but they are applicable in different situations. Initiative is useful in situations where someone needs to take charge and be a leader, while resourcefulness is useful in situations where someone needs to come up with creative solutions to problems.

quotes.Text: So many people are campaigning, fighting, and even dying to make a statement in the name of humanity. These people have no voice that can be heard by many. I wish more celebrities would take the initiative to be that voice.
quotes.Title: English Celebrity
quotes.Name: Jameela Jamil

quotes.Text: There is a heavy emphasis in Mormonism on initiative, on responsibility, on a work ethic, and on education. If you take those elements together with a free-enterprise system, you've got the chemistry for a lot of industry.
quotes.Title: American Educator
quotes.Name: Stephen Covey

quotes.Text: We launched our #WomenWhoWork initiative to show the world what today's modern, professional women really look like. They're invested in their careers, but they're also passionate about priorities outside the office.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Ivanka Trump

quotes.Text: I'm a public figure. It's up to me to take the initiative to explain things. It's my responsibility.

quotes.Name: Isabelle Adjani

quotes.Text: The important thing is to concentrate upon what you can do - by yourself, upon your own initiative.

quotes.Name: Harry Browne

quotes.Text: Time is neutral and does not change things. With courage and initiative, leaders change things.
quotes.Title: American Activist
quotes.Name: Jesse Jackson

quotes.Text: Local innovation and initiative can help us better understand how to protect our environment.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: Gale Norton

quotes.Text: You cannot build character and courage by destroying men's initiative and independence.

quotes.Name: William J. H. Boetcker

quotes.Text: Economic growth is the most important initiative every governor faces.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Dave Heineman

quotes.Text: Believe in individual initiatives, in courage, in risk.
quotes.Title: French Politician
quotes.Name: Emmanuel Macron
